function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Overwhelmed academic publishing and research output","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Deleterious consequences of lockdown measures for health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential for inadequate review of covid-19 impacts leading to misinformation and ineffective policies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift from traditional intellectual engagement to quick, ’what works’ strategies","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid reporting on a wide range of research papers with limited rigor and depth","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited capacity for systematic review due to time constraints","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid completion of a single reviewer study of 200+ papers","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Influence of author’s affect, emotion, and biography on the review process","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of data on ipv and dv rates leading to inaccurate conclusions and decision-making.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public dissemination of uncritically reported news stories and data on ipv and dv rates.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure of preliminary research results on ipv and dv to the media prior to peer review.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of qualitative data and victim voices in accounts of violence","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of displacement pressure on health-harming behaviors","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards home-based health-harming behaviors","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Narratives of freedom from interference may lead to refusal of public health policies, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Introduction of surveillance and scrutiny in private spaces","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Controversial nature of making health-harming behaviors visible","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of backlash against the cost of surveillance at home","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for the link between value and risk","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overprovision of information and functionality leading to increased project cost","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliability and consistency of data collection and analysis may overlook the impact of contagious diseases and their influence on project management and value engineering","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact on labor costs, project costs, and recovery of damages","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity and proper guidance in the virtual workforce","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Liquidity risk may cause work stoppage due to fragile economic scenario.","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased workload and need for regular maintenance among blue-collar workers in commercial buildings.","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in productivity due to working with personal protective equipment and lengthening working hours to 12 hours","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disputes between client and contractor regarding loss-sharing and claims due to covid-19","category":"Working","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of value-based approach in indian construction sector","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low implementation of value engineering in construction projects","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited functionality improvement with new technology","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on environmental protection and social issues","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address sustainable development goals","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disregard for sustainable consumption and production","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of human health in sustainability goals","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of inclusion of human health in the definition of sustainability","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address physical and mental health as a separate fourth pillar of sustainability","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of 'society' as inclusive of human health","category":"Sustainability","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic instability, decreased conservation efforts, and plummeting economy due to covid-19","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pressure on corporations to reevaluate globalized supply chain systems","category":"Wealth Production","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of communicable diseases in ’healthy urban planning’ literature and policy","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and economic consequences of implementing public health measures","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of literature reviews on the connection between npis and urban planning and design in the context of pandemics","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Less stringent approach to reviewing the literature, such as rapid reviews, leading to scope for heterogeneity in the employment of rapid reviews","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Examination of multi-disciplinary literature on how planning and designing cities intersects with pandemics of infectious respiratory diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limiting search terms based on authors’ personal interests may lead to overlooking important aspects of the intersection between pandemics and urban planning.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid review process may result in overlooking key studies and relevant literature, leading to biased conclusions and recommendations.","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of formal quality appraisal tool used in the review","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Considerable overlap between themes and papers crossing themes","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connection allocation based on reviewers’ interests and areas of expertise","category":"Education","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inclusion and exclusion criteria for research may not cover all relevant urban contexts related to pandemics of respiratory diseases, leading to a limited scope of the study.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
